title: IMAGINON : turns 10 in October, kicks off a yearlong celebration with a festival
content:
Just 10 years ago in October, Mecklenburg County became the host of an amazing collaboration. Now that collaboration will kick off a yearlong celebration with a festival on Oct. 10 .  

The building that would be called ImaginOn : The Joe and Joan Martin Center , settled into a spot on the outskirts of Uptown Charlotte where it welcomed curious onlookers with a festive purple, blue and green facade, and a roof that seemed to reach for the sky.  

Inside, an award-winning children's library and equally renowned children's theater partnered to become a one-stop shop for education and entertainment for the community, the region and beyond. 

Though Spangler Children's Library , the Teen Loft and the Children's Theatre of Charlotte each have their own individual identities, together as ImaginOn , they are living proof that the whole is far greater than the sum of its parts.  

On October 10 from noon to 4 p.m. , ImaginOn will ring in its 10-year anniversary with a free, fun-filled festival that will include live performances by Liz, Holly, & The Jolly Lollies, birthday crafts, robotics and gaming, costume characters, backstage tours, and more. 

The entire community is invited to participate in this kick-off to a yearlong celebration with events each month that will commemorate the anniversary.
